page.title: 18Clubs & Local Organizations.
page.content: Of l9l local people interviewed 52.8% were not members of any local community organizations. The remainder listed l04 seperate groups of varying sorts in which they were invoived. Church groups (ll%), represented the single most important category. In Lobley Hill and Sunniside - although not Whickham membership of Working Mens' Clubs is popular (7.5%), while womens' organizations claimed only 2.8%. Groups for young people were supported by 6.l% while a variety of activities whose objectives were mainly cultural or educational covering everything from school P.T.A.'s to Operatic Societies had the interest of 5.l%. Hobby groups (2.8%) ranged from a Motor Restoration Club, through gardening to a knitting machine circle. '
